content.raw: I believe the naming is intentional. If you look at the `SetLinkState` feature in `include/ignition/physics/Link.hh`, you'll see that it has a `SetTorque` function in the `Link` class and a `SetLinkTorque` function in the `Implementation` class. This file is part of the implementation, so it uses the `SetLinkTorque` function name, but the user side code will call something like `link->SetTorque(...)`
content.html: I believe the naming is intentional. If you look at the SetLinkState feature in include/ignition/physics/Link.hh, you'll see that it has a SetTorque function in the Link class and a SetLinkTorque function in the Implementation class. This file is part of the implementation, so it uses the SetLinkTorque function name, but the user side code will call something like link->SetTorque(...)
